title: using ...default syntax for a type implementing Drop gives a cryptic error

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: https://play.integer32.com/?version=stable&mode=debug&edition=2021&gist=e102832a5f43e97abef2948a54648236

```rust
#[derive(Default)]
pub struct Blah {
    a: u8,
    b: Vec<u8>,
}

impl Drop for Blah {
    fn drop(&mut self) {}
}

fn main() {
    let _x = Blah {
        a: 0,
        ..Default::default()
    };
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0509]: cannot move out of type `Blah`, which implements the `Drop` trait
  --> src/main.rs:12:14
   |
12 |       let _x = Blah {
   |  ______________^
13 | |         a: 0,
14 | |         ..Default::default()
15 | |     };
   | |     ^
   | |     |
   | |_____cannot move out of here
   |       move occurs because value has type `Vec<u8>`, which does not implement the `Copy` trait

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0509`.
```
Ideally the output should look like:

I'm not sure, honestly. But it would be better if the span pointed only to the `..Default::default()` part. As an aside, I don't think it's clear that this statement creates a full instance of `Blah`, not just "the rest of the fields". Maybe a note explaining this could be added.
